topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Allocating and Associating Floating IP Addresses

body.p: Floating IP addresses allow external access to the instances in your network.

li.xref: Associate floating IPs to running instances
Allocate floating IPs to a project

body.p: Note: You must have an external network configured for the project. Without an external network, a floating IP address is not available. When you create an external network, a pool of IP addresses is created, which you can associate to the instances on a network.

section.title: Associate floating IPs to running instances
section.p: To assign a floating IP address to an instance:

ol.li: Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Dashboard.
Click the Instances link on the Project dashboard Compute panel.

For the network you want to associate the IP address, click the drop-down next to Create Snapshot then Associate Floating IP.
Note: Instances that are in error cannot be assigned a floating IP address.

In the Manage Floating IP Associations screen, select an address from the IP Address. This list contains the currently allocated IP addresses.
Note: If the list is empty, you will need to allocate an IP address before you can associate an address to a network. Click Cancel and see .
In the Port to be Associated list, select the instance and port that you want to associate with the floating IP address.

section.title: Allocate floating IPs to a project
section.p: Before associating a floating IP address to an instance, the floating IP address must be allocated for use.
To allocate a floating IP address:

ol.li: Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Dashboard.
Click the Instances link on the Project dashboard Compute panel.
For the network you want to associate the IP address, click the drop-down next to Create Snapshot then Associate Floating IP.
In the Manage Floating IP Associations screen, click the + button next to the IP Address list.
In the Allocate Floating IP screen, select the appropriate external network in the Pool list. Select the network to which the instance connects.

section.p: A floating IP address is added to the IP Address list in the Manage Floating IP Associations screen.
The floating address can be associated to an instance.

section.title: Disassociate a floating IP address from a network.
section.p: To remove a floating IP address from an instance:

ol.li: Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Dashboard.
Click the Instances link on the Project dashboard Compute panel.
For the network you want to disassociate the IP address, click the drop-down next to Create Snapshot then Disassociate Floating IP.
In the confirmation screen, click Disassociate Floating IP.

section.p: The floating IP address is removed and the instance is no longer accessible from the external network.
